subject: Psychology
title: The Gambler's Fallacy
description: A quick, practical guide to The Gambler's Fallacy.

hook.text: The roulette wheel landed on black six times in a row. Everyone bets red. Black hits again.

buildup.text: The gambler's fallacy is believing that past random events affect future probabilities.

discovery.text: Each coin flip is independent. After 10 heads, the chance of tails is still exactly 50%.

twist.text: In 1913, a Monte Carlo roulette wheel hit black 26 times. Gamblers lost millions betting on red.

climax.text: We crave patterns so much that we see them in randomness â€” and bet our money on the illusion.

quiz.question: What is the gambler's fallacy?
options: Believing past random events affect future probabilities
